subject: Golf
Blindness
lead_paragraph: An 85-year-old legally blind golfer from southern Arizona made a hole in one this week on a par-3 course. Robert Dunham accomplished the feat on the third hole at Tortuga in Green Valley. Dunham played with a group of fellow blind veterans enrolled in a Veterans Affairs health program. A volunteer assistant lined him up with the ball, handed him a 9-iron and stepped back. “I thought they were kidding me,” said Dunham, a World War II veteran who lost his vision about 10 years ago. “I told them, ‘You guys better not be pulling my leg.’  ”.
